JobFullDesc:
Global Commercial Services supports businesses around the world with commercial payments solutions and products to help them run and grow their businesses. The Kabbage & Business Financing team, within Product Marketing, focuses on commercial non-card lending and payments solutions. This is an opportunity for an individual to drive continued growth for the Kabbage Portfolio. The Kabbage suite of products provide differentiated value to American Express customers and prospects by addressing their need for convenient and price-competitive financing. Key objectives of the group are to enhance value to small businesses while driving profitable revenue growth for the company. 

The team is seeking a dynamic, entrepreneurial individual to lead go-to-market strategies for customer and prospect acquisition of the Kabbage suite of products across the following target segments: Consumer small businesses, Amex merchants and pure prospects. This is a highly visible, strategic, fast-paced and dynamic role that will enable the Manager / Senior Manager to advance professional development across a broad set of critical knowledge areas. 
Responsibilities Include:
Partner with key internal stakeholders across the enterprise, including Global Merchant & Network Services, US Consumer Marketing and Global Commercial Prospect Marketing team to develop and execute a robust marketing strategy to those respective target audiences
Lead the go-to-market strategy and execution for the Kabbage suite of products across direct mail and email
Explore and drive additional marketing opportunities across new channel opportunities, specifically leveraging internal partner-owned distribution channels
Develop a test & learn curriculum based on campaign performance and product roadmap feature releases
Monthly campaign strategy and end-to-end channel management including working with external agency partners to develop compelling creative and targeted messaging
Align with additional stakeholders across product, EDA, Risk and Kabbage teams to drive forward the marketing strategy
Manage the overall internal partnerships marketing Pod, which includes 1 analyst
 
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. 
As marketers at one of the most iconic brands in the world, we play a major role in building authentic relationships with customers who impact life and business around the world. Here, creativity and inspired storytelling combine with powerful data-based marketing and hyper-personalized digital communication to create a genuine human connection that drives business results. As a part of our diverse community of marketers, you can have a breadth of different marketing experiences and do virtually anything from connecting small businesses to new customers to uncovering insights that inspire the future of payments.  Create a dynamic career while doing work that matters for people and businesses everywhere. 
 
 
 

Ability to build and leverage relationships and influence across functions and band levels
Creative thinker with a strong customer focus who is comfortable with ambiguity and evolving strategies in Agile environment
Proven strategic marketer who can connect the dots between backend processes with front-end customer experience
Track record of driving innovation and change
Proven analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to multi-task
Detail oriented with strong focus on driving results
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
B2B marketing experience preferred, but not required
 
 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
